metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6136 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the audit_log_single_execve_arg function in kernel/auditsc.c in the Linux kernel through 4.7 allows local users to bypass intended character-set restrictions or disrupt system-call auditing by changing a certain string, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability. Pengfei Wang discovered a race condition in the audit subsystem in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to corrupt audit logs or disrupt system-call auditing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6136` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-38-generic - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-lowlatency - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-38-generic - 4.4.0-38.57
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> allows corruption of audit logs

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-38.57').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1023.29').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-38.57').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.29').
